text: The Tomorrow War is an upcoming American military science fiction action film directed by Chris McKay in his live-action directorial debut, produced by David Ellison, Dana Goldberg, Don Granger, David S. Goyer, Jules Daly and Adam Kolbrenner, and written by Zach Dean and Bill Dubuque. The film will star Chris Pratt, Yvonne Strahovski, Betty Gilpin, Keith Powers, Mike Mitchell, Sam Richardson, and J. K. Simmons, with Pratt also executive producing the film. The film, which is set in the near future, focuses on humanity's war against an invading alien force, hoping to win it by using scientists' new ability to draft soldiers from the past to the war. The film was scheduled to be released on December 25, 2020, by Paramount Pictures, but was rescheduled to July 23, 2021, due to the COVID-19 pandemic.https://www.kxan.com/entertainment- news/top-gun-maverick-postponed-to-december-due-to-coronavirus/amp/ ==Premise== The fate of a futuristic war rests upon one man's abilities to confront the ghosts of his past. Humanity is losing to an alien invasion, so to fight back, scientists develop a way to draft soldiers from the past to fight the war. ==Cast== ==Production== It was announced in February 2019 that Chris Pratt was in negotiations to star in the film (then known as Ghost Draft), and which was set to be directed by Chris McKay. In July, Yvonne Strahovski was added to the cast. J. K. Simmons, Betty Gilpin, Sam Richardson, Theo Von, Jasmine Mathews, Keith Powers were added to the cast in August, with Mary Lynn Rajskub, Edwin Hodge, and additional cast joining in September.Mary Lynn Rajskub, Edwin Hodge Join Chris Pratt in Sci-Fi Thriller 'Ghost Draft' (Exclusive)‘Ghost Draft’: Paramount/Skydance Sci-Fi Film Adds More To Cast The movie was retitled as The Tomorrow War. Creature designer Ken Barthelmey designed the aliens for the film. ===Filming=== Filming began on September 1, 2019, with Atlanta and Iceland as filming locations. Filming wrapped on January 12, 2020. ==Release== The film was originally scheduled to be released on December 25, 2020 by Paramount Pictures. But due to the COVID-19 pandemic, it was rescheduled to July 23, 2021, taking the release date of Mission: Impossible 7. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Upcoming films Category:American science fiction action films Category:American films Category:American science fiction war films Category:Films scored by Lorne Balfe Category:Films shot in Atlanta Category:Films shot in Iceland Category:Paramount Pictures films Category:Films postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic
